thread.title: Arsenal news: Arsenal worse than ten-men Shakhtar Donetsk side beaten 7-0 by Bayern Munich, says Raphael Honigstein | Metro News
thread.title_full: Arsenal news: Arsenal worse than ten-men Shakhtar Donetsk side beaten 7-0 by Bayern Munich, says Raphael Honigstein | Metro News

author: Coral Barry For Metro.Co.Uk
title: Arsenal news: Arsenal worse than ten-men Shakhtar Donetsk side beaten 7-0 by Bayern Munich, says Raphael Honigstein | Metro News
text:
Coral Barry for Metro.co.uk Sunday 19 Feb 2017 7:49 pm Arsene Wenger labeled the loss a ‘strange game’ (Picture: Getty) 
Arsenal are the worst side to ever play Bayern Munich in the Champions League knockout stages, according to Bundesliga pundit Raphael Honigstein. Theo Walcott left red-faced as Arsenal fans slam club for 'disrespectful'gesture 
The Gunners were beaten 5-1 by Bayern in Germany in the first leg of their last-16 tie and Honigstein believes Arsene Wenger’s side were worse than Shakhtar Donetsk who were beaten 7-0. 
Bayern played a ten-man Shakhtar in the second leg of their last-16 tie in March 2015 and Honigstein thinks even that side was better than Arsenal were against the Germans. 
‘It was all about Arsenal being horrifically bad,’ Honigstein told BT Sport. Arsenal fixtures 
Sutton – FA Cup (A) – Mon 20 Feb Liverpool (A) – Sat 4 Mar Bayern Munich – Champions League (H) – Tue 7 Mar Leicester (H) – Sat 11 Mar West Brom (A) – Sat 18 Mar Manchester City (H) – Sat 1 Apr West Ham (H) – Tue 4 Apr Crystal Palace (A) – Sat 8 Apr Bayern Munich tore Arsenal to pieces in Munich (Picture: Getty) 
‘I don’t think I’ve ever seen a knockout tie at this stadium with an opposition so inept. 
‘Even Shakhtar Donetsk and Basel who both lost 7-0 weren’t quite as disorganized as that Arsenal team.’ 
Basel were also humiliated by Bayern in 2012 when they lost by the same scoreline in the Champions League. Shakhtar Donetsk played 87 minutes with ten men (Picture: Getty)
